title: Volunteer: Curriculum Development Summer Internship
requirements:
Founded in April 2017 and officially incorporated in July 2018, Robotics for All aims to bridge close the opportunity gap by providing equitable educational opportunities to students of all backgrounds, particularly underrepresented and underserved students. Our organization previously only provided in-person classes. In July 2020, due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we transitioned our program to an online setting and experienced breakneck growth. In just 5 months, we taught the same number of students as we did in our first 3 years of operations. Our current online classes are for K-8 grader and teach a variety of platforms including Code.org, Scratch, and Python.

Robotics for All is volunteer-based, with currently over 100 volunteers at the time of writing. Our volunteers hail from dozens of states across the United States and several other countries. We encourage you to apply to join our growing community of volunteers.
Across the country, millions of students lack the resources to learn about STEM and computer science. Our non-profit organization, Robotics for All, strives to provide this vital area of education to underprivileged students through engaging online classes.

Robotics for All is seeking volunteer curriculum development interns for this summer (2021). As a summer intern, you will earn service hours while developing critical communication, organization, and leadership skills, all of which will assist you in varying areas of interest. Interns work in helping to develop one of two new curricula Data Science in Python or Sustainability and Climate Change.

If you are interested in joining our team, please read the full position description and apply by April 31st with the following link https //www.roboticsforall.net/summer-internship.html. Late applications will not be accepted.

We look forward to engineering the future with you!

This is a volunteer opportunity provided by VolunteerMatch, in partnership with LinkedIn for Good.

title: Intern Cisneros Institute for Emerging Leaders
requirements:
Under the direct supervision of the Director of the Cisneros Institute for Emerging Leaders, the Intern will be responsible for assisting in the development of all leadership certificates. As a growing institute, we are partnering across campus and in the San Antonio community to offer leadership certificates that are population and topic specific. We currently offer two leadership certificates: Emerging Leader Certificate and the Aspiring Teachers Leadership Certificate for first-year transfer students. Our goal is to offer three additional leadership certificates by 2022. The Intern's key responsibility will be to develop the curriculum and presentations for the certificates. In addition, they will support with the development and execution of a summer residential program for 24 high school students taking place July 18-23, 2021.

A successful Intern should possess excellent communication, organization, administration, and project management skills as well as a commitment to educate students, engage the community, and enrich the Jaguar experience.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Lead the development of curriculum writing and presentations for all leadership certificates.
Support in ensuring a seamless delivery of leadership certificates which include: certificate development and delivery, certificate logistics, and participantsâ€™ communication and ongoing engagement.
Assist in the assessment, evaluation, planning, implementation and evaluation of leadership development programs.
Find or create materials, such as activities, processes, documentations of learning, and assessments. Revise modules during the process according to internal feedback.
Serve on campus and departmental committees related to leadership development and student engagement as needed.
Work collaboratively with other students and professional staff in the Cisneros Institute for Emerging Leaders to accomplish various programming and training goals.
Support with the development and execution of a summer residential program for 24 high school students taking place July 18-23, 2021. Must be available on these dates.
Education and Experience:

Continued good standing as a graduate student in a graduate degree-granting program.
Experience in curriculum and professional learning, including writing and development of curriculum.
Knowledge of and experience in developing year-long or semester-long courses.
Knowledgeable of student leadership theories.
Strong interpersonal communication skills and the ability to interact with a diverse population.
Demonstrated experience and skills related to program development, leadership development, student development and working with groups.
Takes initiative, demonstrates strong leadership ability, and demonstrates a strong commitment to leadership development.
Be a positive representative of A&M-SA; foster a caring and inclusive environment to our Jaguar family.
Familiarity with Gallup Strengths, not required but highly desired.

Full Job Description: https://tamus.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/TAMUSA_External/job/San-Antonio-TAMUSA/Intern-I_R-036589
